descriptionNullable:
British Airways Reviews 2016-2023

An Interactive Dashboard

Tableau Dashboard: https://public.tableau.com/app/profile/vin.esposito/viz/BritishAirwaysReviews_17082894676940/Dashboard1 

Dataset: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/vinesposito/britishairwaysreviews

Introduction

After obtaining the datasets from all reviews of British Airways between March 2016 and October 2023, it’s time to see what works best for the company, and which areas need the most improvement.   Should BA focus catering their future marketing toward business travelers? Leisure travelers? Families? Solo travelers?  Let’s see what the data tells us…

Questions

1.	What areas received the strongest reviews from BA customers?
2.	What areas received the weakest reviews from BA customers?
3.	What traveler types leave the most positive reviews?
4.	What do travelers need the most support with?
5.	Should we cater more towards larger families or solo travelers?
6.	Are leisure travelers or business travelers more satisfied with BA’s service?
7.	Are review scores trending up or down?

Data Approach

1.	Dataset uploaded to Kaggle: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/vinesposito/britishairwaysreviews 
2.	We will be using graphic visualizations to answer the questions above.
3.	A total of four visualizations were used to build out this dashboard.  
Data Analysis

I made a dashboard displaying all of them (will be linked to this document).
I decided to go with four different visualizations to answer the questions above.
First, we have an interactive map that you can sort by review criteria:
 
Secondly, we can see trends over time given a certain criteria in a line graph:
 
Third, we have metrics measured by the types of aircrafts:
 

And finally, all metrics will updated in real time, depending on the filters the user prefers:

 
 
With all these tools in place, we can get to answering the relevant questions.
1.	What areas received the strongest reviews from BA customers?
 
When accounting for all reviews between March 2016 and October 2023, the strongest areas are the cabin staff service and the ground service.  

2.	What areas received the weakest reviews from BA customers?

On the other hand, clearly the weakest area according to BA customer reviews is the in-flight entertainment.  While we don’t have access to any qualitative data explaining why, it may be useful to reach out to customers who left these reviews and figure out why.  Perhaps it was a poor selection of movies and shows (haven’t we all been there on flights?).  This would be important to address considering BA is the largest international carrier in the UK.  Chances are their flights will be longer given the distance needed to travel. 

3.	What traveler types leave the most positive reviews?

Both solo and couple leisure travelers tend to leave the most positive reviews (average rating of 4.29 and 4.25, respectively).
 
 
 
 
In  both groups,  the strongest areas of the reviews are still cabin staff service and ground service, while the weakest area is still entertainment.  
4.	What do travelers need the most support with?
In virtually all subgroups, entertainment is the weakest area of the reviews.  
5.	Should we cater more towards larger families or solo travelers?
 
 
Of the leisure travelers, families left the lowest average review scores in general.  Solo leisure travelers and couple leisure travelers left similar review scores across the board.   Leveraging this is useful considering business travelers tend to travel alone as well.
6.	Are leisure travelers or business travelers more satisfied with BA’s service?
Here are the statistics for business travelers…
 
 
And here is the information for leisure travelers (solo, couple, and family combined)…

 
 
While the average ratings appear to be similar, the leisure travelers were more positive in each individual category.  It is also important to note that if we filter our families, then the leisure travelers tend to leave more positive ratings.

 
 
7.	Are review scores trending up or down?
From March 2016 towards October 2023, they appear to be trending down.
 
The trends appear to be sloping negatively, and this can be for a few reasons.  First off, there were clearly going to be less reviews when many flights were canceled due to COVID during 2020, which explains the first major valley on the graph above.   Digging deeper, it turns out BA cut flights again in early 2022 due to the omicron variant.   There also appears be a class action lawsuit against BA for customers not receiving refunds from flights canceled due to COVID-19.

While some of this may be hypothetical, it is possible the treatment of customers during and beyond the COVID-19 pandemic could have negatively impacted the customer outlook on BA, which is why review scores have been trending down since 2022.

Conclusion
And that’s what we have from this dashboard.  There’s plenty of other insights you can take from it.  We could dive down deeper and see if there are correlations between each of the aircraft types.  The goal in this writeup was to give a general overview of reviews, which areas may need to be improved, and what the outlook is going forward.
Thanks for reading!
title: British Airways Reviews 2016-2023
subtitle: An Interactive Dashboard Story
